title: YES Bank looks to exit FY26 with ROA of 1 pc: CFO
content:
YES Bank's CFO, Niranjan Banodkar, aims to bring a significant improvement in the bank's performance by achieving an ROI ratio of only 1 percentage point (ROA) at the close of FY26. This strategic move is aimed at enhancing investor confidence and ensuring long-term profitability for YES Bank.

YES Bank targets exit with ROA of 1 pc: CFO speaks on financial prospects

In the quest to improve its standing and maintain shareholder confidence, YES Bank’s management team is focusing on achieving an ROI ratio of just 1 percentage point (ROA) in FY26. The CFO, Niranjan Banodkar, outlines strategies that could pave the way for a stronger financial future.

YES Bank targets exit with ROA of 1 pc: CFO speaks on financial prospects

In an effort to boost investor confidence and ensure sustainable growth, YES Bank’s management team has set ambitious goals. The company aims to achieve a return on investment (ROI) ratio of only 1 percentage point by the end of FY26 under CFO Niranjan Banodkar's leadership.

YES Bank targets exit with ROA of 1 pc: CFO speaks on financial prospects

As YES Bank prepares to conclude its fiscal year 2026 (FY26), the company's management is focusing on a strategic move that could significantly impact their performance. The CFO, Niranjan Banodkar, outlines how achieving an ROI ratio of just 1 percentage point (ROA) will be key to the bank’s financial outlook.
